DataElement.preferredName: Oral Lesion Present Indicator Description Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents whether or not an oral lesion is present and a description of the gross appearance.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
